DOC.brief_summary: Chronic sinusitis is a frequent complication in cystic fibrosis. The aim of this study is to determine whether Pulmozyme(dornase alfa) would maintain sinus health (compared to placebo) in patients with cystic fibrosis who have recently undergone sinus surgery.
DOC.brief_title: Nasally Delivered Pulmozyme for Sinusitis in Cystic Fibrosis
DOC.detailed_description: AIM: To evaluate the effectiveness of Pulmozyme(dornase alfa) in decreasing post-operative sinusitis symptoms in patients with cystic fibrosis (CF) PROCEDURES: 20 patients with CF will be randomized to receive either Pulmozyme or placebo via nasal inhalation daily for 12 months. Consent will be obtained following surgery and treatment will begin 1 week post-operatively. Monitoring will include examination and recording of adverse effects and follow up weekly for one month and then at 2.5, 6, 9 and 12 months. Outcome measures will include ciliary function testing, pulmonary function testing, sinus questionnaires and CT scan.
DOC.criteria: Clinical and laboratory diagnosis of cystic fibrosis Age greater than or equal to 5 years Forced expiratory volume in 1 second (FEV1) greater than or equal to 40% predicted Sinus surgery within one week of enrollment Pregnancy Intolerance of orally inhaled Pulmozyme (dornase alfa)
